alert.note: Alert for Shenandoah (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:01PM EDT until July 01 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SHENANDOAH AND SOUTHWESTERN FREDERICK COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...EAST CENTRAL HARDY AND EASTERN HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA... At 501 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Paw Paw to near Strasburg, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Star Tannery, Capon Bridge, Augusta, Gravel Springs, Yellow Spring, High View, Three Churches, Wilde Acres, Higginsville, Slanesville, Points, Delray, Rock Enon Springs, Capon Springs, Timber Ridge, Lehew, Bloomery and Fishers Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
